intro: Houstonia rupicola, commonly known as the rocky mountain bluets, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, blue to violet flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in partial to full shade. Its delicate appearance and preference for specific habitats make it a notable species in ecological studies. Houstonia rupicola is often found in woodlands and along stream banks, where it contributes to local biodiversity.
